name: Alien Abduction
effect:
Solanagen-based aliens, existing in a subspace domain,
can access our universe and abduct humanoids for study.

Most CUNNING Away Team member (owner's choice
if tie) is held captive by aliens until mission completed
OR 3 Leadership present.

Errata - Removed the word 'captive' to make it clear it's
not a capture-related card.

name: Alien Groupie
effect:
Lanel, a Malcorian nurse, agreed to help Commander
William T. Riker, but only if he would...

Plays on any Away Team which has just completed a
planet mission. Female groupie delays beam up of one
male (random selection) for one full turn.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Alien Parasites
effect:
Intelligent parasites enter and take control of a humanoid.
Their presence can be detected by a gill like protrusion on
the back of a host's neck.

Unless INTEGRITY>32, Away Team infected. They
beam back and opponent immediately controls ship
and crew until "stopped." Then turn resumes.

name: Alien Probe
effect:
Space probes of unknown origin are frequently
encountered by starships. Often such probes seek
information or contact.

Plays on table. Both players continue the game with
their hands (cards) exposed, face up on table.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Amanda Rogers
effect:
Female Q raised as a human on Earth. Was taken to the Q
continuum by Q after she could not resist the benevolent
use of her powers.

Nullifies any one Interrupt card just played (except
Kevin Uxbridge or another Amanda Rogers) OR any
one artifact other card just played as an Interrupt card. Countdown = 0
Errata - Added point box so you can't reuse.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Anaphasic Organism
effect:
A male non-corporeal life-form that lives inside a female
host which he enchants, as in the case of Dr. Beverly
Crusher's late grandmother.

If Female(s) in Away Team, the one with highest total
attribute numbers resigns (is discarded), unless
SECURITY and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

name: Ancient Computer
effect:
Vital information can be retrieved from old or damaged
computer systems like this one aboard a derelict
Promellian battlecruiser.

Cannot get past unless 2 Computer Skill OR 3 SCIENCE
OR 3 ENGINEER present.

name: Anti-Time Anomaly
effect:
Q-created phenomena. Rift caused by anti-time particles in
the future. Anomaly grows backward in time endangering
all life in the past.

Plays on table. Kills literally ALL personnel on table
in play (both players' cards) at the end of your third
full turn, unless anti-time anomaly destroyed first.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Archer
effect:
Indigenous inhabitants, such as this Mintakan bowman,
often attack an Away Team out of fear.

Away Team member with highest total attribute
numbers is shot and dies unless SECURITY and
MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

name: Armus - Skin of Evil
effect:
A Mmalevolent being was formed when the inhabitants of Vagra II
rid themselves of all the evil they have had inside.

Kills one Away Team member (random selection).
Discard dilemma.

Errata - These corrections are present on the PU95 & Reflections
versions of this card

name: Asteroid Sanctuary
effect:
Hoping to avoid detection by a Romulan Warbird, the
U.S.S. Enterprise entered a giant asteroid cavern in 2370.

Plays on any ship. If 2 Navigation aboard, hides ship to
prevent any battle initiated against that ship for this turn.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Atmospheric Ionization
effect: Icon Bar - ✤
Charged particles in the atmosphere of planets which can disrupt transporter beams.
Plays crosswise on any planet location. Maximum of three personnel per turn can be beamed up or down at this location.
Errata - Nerf. Made it unique.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Auto-Destruct Sequence
effect:
Computer controlled self-destruct countdown which can be
set by the senior officers aboard a ship.

Plays on one of your own ships. Ship self-destructs at
end of your turn. Explosion damages all other ships at
same location that which have SHIELDS<8.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Avert Disaster
effect:
Artrea: Aid project to delay solidification of the
planet's core.

Geology + Honor + Integrity>35

name: Barclay's Protomorphosis Disease
effect:
Contagious affliction which causes animals to de-evolve
into ancestral forms. Disease named for Lieutenant
Reginald Barclay.

Entire crew or Away Team (except Androids)
de-evolves (dies) unless MEDICAL, SCIENCE
and SECURITY present. Discard dilemma Points = 10

name: Betazoid Gift Box
effect:
Traditional device for presenting important gifts. Its
sculpted face comes to life boisterously presenting its
contents to the recipient.

Immediately look through your draw deck for up to
thirty seconds and choose three cards to place in your
hand. Reshuffle draw deck and discard artifact.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Birth of "Junior"
effect:
Large infant spaceborne life-form. Attached itself to the
U.S.S. Enterprise in 2368, sucking energy from the ship.

Place on ship. Range reduced by 1 each turn until
3 ENGINEER aboard which discards "Junior" and
restores range. If Range=0, ship is destroyed.
End of each turn, RANGE reduced by 1; if
reduced to 0, ship destroyed. Nullify with
3 ENGINEER.

Errata - No functional changes. Modernized game text
for readability.

name: Borg Ship
effect: Icon Bar - Added [Self]

Gigantic cubic ship of the Borg collective. Possesses
powerful weapons and remarkable regenerative abilities.

Self-controlling ship (WEAPONS=24, SHIELDS=24).
Start here. Attacks everything. End of every turn
moves 1 card toward and off spaceline's long end.
Destroy for bonus. Points = 45 Place at furthest
spaceline end. End of every turn: Attacks all
ships, then moves. Worth points if destroyed in
battle. Points = 15

Errata - Nerf (so encountering ship wouldn't go poof),
and made it a self-controlled.

name: Bynars Weapon Enhancement
effect:
Binary race closely integrated with computers. Always
work in pairs. Bynars have the ability to enhance specific
computerized systems.

Plays on table. Bynars enhance each of your ship's
ship. Ship is WEAPONS +2. (Cumulative.)
Errata - Nerf. so it doesn't affect every ship you have.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Chalnoth
effect:
Anarchistic lupine race of humanoids with the reputation of
violent responses to a variety of situations.

Kills one Away Team member (opponent's
choice) unless 3 SECURITY OR STRENGTH>40
present. Discard dilemma. Points = 5

name: Cloaked Mission
effect:
Romulus System Region • Romulus: Secretly escort
covert operatives to the Romulan homeworld.

Navigation + Diplomacy + Honor
Errata - Early region mission.

name: Cosmic String Fragment
effect:
A long space object as thin as a proton but with the
gravitational attraction of a hundred stars.

Ship is sucked in and destroyed unless
Astrophysics OR Engineer OR Navigation
aboard. Discard dilemma. Points = 5

name: Covert Installation
effect:
Lore - Neutral Zone Region • Devora: Build hidden monitoring station in the Neutral Zone.
Reason - Early region mission.

name: Crosis
effect:
Fanatical Borg lieutenant of Lore. Captured Lt. Commander
Data with the lure of emotions.

Plays on Rogue Borg. Doubles their STRENGTH,
including himself. Two Borg =4 STRENGTH each, three
Borg =6 STRENGTH each, etc. (Not cumulative.)
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Crystalline Entity
effect:
Spaceborne life-form strips biological energy from planets
and ships. Sensitive to modulation much like crystal can
shatter from a high pitch note.

Space mission: Kills all life on ship unless SHIELDS>6
OR Music aboard. Planet mission: Kills entire Away Team
unless SCIENCE and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.
Points = 5

name: Cytherians
effect:
Race which explores the galaxy by giving other species the
temporary ability and strong compulsion to come to them.

Place on ship. Ship must do nothing but travel
to far end of spaceline at normal speed. When
reached, discard dilemma. Score points.
Points = 15

name: Disruptor Overload
effect:
A directed-energy weapon can be set on overload and left
to explode like a bomb.

Plays on any ship or Away Team. One Equipment card
OR one artifact played as an Equipment card, is
destroyed at that location Where present, destroys
one Equipment card or one card used as an
Equipment card (random selection).
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext

name: Distortion Field
effect: Icon Bar - ✤

Atmospheric phenomena that inhibits use of transporters
as on Nervala IV.

Plays crosswise face up on any planet location. On each
of your turns, flip card over. While face up, prevents
any beam down here unless pattern enhancers in play.
beaming down/up here.
Errata - Nerf. Made it unique.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Distortion of Space/Time Continuum
effect:
Time effects can be caused by the unusual warping or
rifting of space.

Any one ship and its Away Team may immediately
make another move. Plays on any ship. "Unstops"
ship, crew, and ship's Away Teams and restores
any of this turn's RANGE already used by that
ship.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext

name: El-Adrel Creature
effect:
Nearly invisible predatory electromagnetic creature. First
encountered by Dathon and Captain Jean-Luc Picard on
El-Adrel IV.

Attacks two strongest members in Away Team (owner's
choice if tie). Kills one of them (random selection)
unless their combined STRENGTH>16. Discard dilemma.

name: Emergency Transporter Armbands
effect:
Time effects can be caused by the unusual warping or
rifting of space.

Beam your Personnel up or down at any time,
even except during a dilemma (unless
specifically permitted). May be used during
battle before the winner is determined.

Errata - Nerf. Can't escape dilemmas unless the
dilemma says you can.

name: Energy Vortex
effect:
Whirlpool-like space/time phenomena that can destroy a
ship, as it nearly did the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2365.

Plays immediately after opponent plays any non-
Interrupt card from hand. That card returns to their
hand and a different one must be played instead.

name: Engineering Kit
effect:
Representative of specialized engineering instruments.
Such equipment has been developed by many races.

Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the
extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

name: Engineering PADD
effect:
Representative of Personal Access Display Devices
designed specifically for engineering functions. Such
equipment has been developed by many races.

Gives all of your SCIENCE-classification personnel the
extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

name: Escape Pod
effect:
Angosian escape pod used by Roga Danar in 2366.
Escape pods can be used in an emergency to save a crew.

Plays on ship being destroyed . Escape pod saves entire
crew. Unseen by enemy ships, crew remains in pod
until personnel rescued. Discard after use.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Espionage: Federation On Klingon
effect:
Federation intelligence-gathering has often relied upon
sympathetic informants and electronic surveillance.

Plays on any Klingon mission. Your Federation
personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after
mission completed.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Espionage: Klingon On Federation
effect:
Klingon espionage against the Federation has included
data stolen from Relay Station 47 by Morag.

Plays on any Federation mission. Your Klingon
personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after
mission completed.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Espionage: Romulan On Federation
effect: Romulan spies are everywhere.

Plays on any Federation mission. Your Romulan
personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after
mission completed.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Espionage: Romulan On Klingon
effect:
Romulan espionage against Klingons has included efforts
to de-stabilize the Klingon government by programming
assassins and supporting rebel forces.

Plays on any Klingon mission. Your Romulan personnel may
now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Evacuation
effect:
Requirements - Diplomacy x3 + Strength STRENGTH >35
Reason - Typo (Strength to STRENGTH)

name: Explore Typhone Expanse
effect:
Title - Explore Typhone Typhon Expanse
Lore - Typhone Typhon Expanse: Trace time distortion reported in this desolate region.
Reason - Typo - spelled Typhon 'Typhone'.

name: Federation
effect: Title - Federation Outpost - added ✤

Earth is a member of the United Federation of Planets. The
Federation establishes outposts throughout its territory.

Seed one if playing Federation OR build later at any
location where you have a Federation ENGINEER is present.
Errata - Outpost cleanup.

name: Federation PADD
effect:
Standard Federation Personnel Access Display Device for
computerized information.

Federation use only. Each of your personnel CUNNING +2
where present. (Cumulative.)

name: Female's Love Interest
effect:
A genetically-engineered leader. Once romantically
involved with Deanna Troi.

Female Away Team member (random selection) runs
off with lover to furthest planet, where she remains.
Can be rescued later. Discard dilemma.
Errata - No functional changes, minor rewording.

name: Firestorm
effect:
With advanced technology, personnel can work together
to survive natural phenomenon such as the firestorms on
Bersallis III.

Kills Aall Away Team members with INTEGRITY<5
are killed unless thermal deflectors present (but
Away Team may escape using Emergency Transporter
Armbands). Discard dilemma.

Errata - No functional change. Emergency Transporter
Armbands always was able to get you out of this dilemma
- the armbands were nerfed.

name: Full Planet Scan
effect:
Sensor instruments can make detailed scans of a planet
surface and atmosphere.

Glance at the Dilemma and Artifact all seed
cards located under one planet mission for
twenty seconds.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Gaps In Normal Space
effect:
Pockets of space, such as those in the Mar Oscura nebula,
dangerously phase out when coming in contact with a ship.

Place between two Mission cards. Creates a gap with a
span of 4. Ships stopping on the gap kill one personnel
(random selection).
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Genetronic Replicator
effect:
PocketsMedical device invented by Dr. Toby Russell. Capable of
growing replacements for damaged organs.

Plays on table. Prevent any of your Away Team
members from being killed if 2 MEDICAL present.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Giusti
effect:
Lore - Ensign Giusti is representative of staff officers in Starfleet. Served at the Ops consol console aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
Reason - Typo in lore.

name: Goddess of Empathy
effect:
Lt. Reginald Barclay created a fantasy holodeck simulation
of Counselor Deanna Troi. Her empathic abilities help other
personnel anticipate danger.

Plays on table until the end of your turn. Neither
you nor your opponent can play Interrupt cards (except
Kevin Uxbridge or Q2). Discard event after use.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Gravitic Mine
effect:
Free-floating weapon used against space vehicles. The
U.S.S. Denver struck such a mine, which caused it to crash
in the Mericor System.

Ship damaged unless SCIENCE and Navigation aboard.
Discard dilemma.

name: Holo-Projectors
effect:
The hologram projector on Minos is an example of planet-
based interactive holographic technology.

Plays on table. This technology allows your holographic
re-creations to be projected and used on any of your
ships or Away Teams. (Immune to Kevin Uxbridge.) a planet
mission. [Holo] cards may exist on this planet.
Errata - Nerf. Now only works on a single planet.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Hologram Ruse
effect: Holograms can be used to create realistic fantasy worlds.

Experience enemy hologram trick. You are tempted to
divulge secrets. Impassable unless INTEGRITY>30 and
CUNNING>30.

Rule - If Away Team meets conditions (INTEGRITY>30 and
CUNNING>30), discard dilemma and continue to next. If not,
Away Team is “stopped”; replace dilemma under mission to
be encountered again.

name: Honor Challenge
effect:
The call to glory inspires the Klingon warrior to maximum
fierceness and honor, as symbolized by the Bat'telh
championship trophy.

Plays just after an Away Team battle is initiated. Each
Klingon with Honor immediately kills one opponent
with Treachery. Battle continues.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Horga'hn
effect:
Mysterious symbol of sexuality from the pleasure planet of
Risa. To own one is to call forth its powers. To display one
is to announce that the owner is seeking jamaharon.

Immediately plays on table. Artifact allows you to take
double turns from now on. (Not cumulative.)
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Hugh
effect:
The Federation named a rescued Borg, Hugh. When he
returned, his newly acquired self-aware personality
collapsed the Borg collective.

Nullifies attack by Borg Ship for this turn OR destroys
(discard ) all Rogue Borg at one location.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Hyper-Aging
effect:
Disease created accidentally at the Darwin Genetic Research
Station on Gagarin IV. Causes rapid aging and death.

Mission continues but entire Away Team is
quarantined and dies at the end of your third full turn
unless SCIENCE and 2 MEDICAL present by that time.
Points=5

name: I.K.C. Bortas
effect:
Lore - Gowron's flagship Flagship commanded by Gowron during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68. Lieutenant Worf briefly served aboard as a weapons officer.
Reason - Cleaned up lore to make it clear that Gowron's captain of this ship.

name: Iconia Investigation
effect:
Lore - Neutral Zone Region • Iconia: Investigate Federation incursion in the Neutral Zone.
Reason - Early region mission.

name: Iconian Computer Weapon
effect:
Highly destructive virus from the ancient extinct Iconians.
Transmitted to target vessels via a probe.

Unless SCIENCE present, re-boot by discarding all
non-personnel cards in hand and replenish from top of
draw deck. Discard dilemma.

name: Impassable Door
effect:
Forcefields across door or hallway openings are commonly
used to bar entry.

To get through this door, Away Team must have
Computer Skill present.

name: Incoming Message – Federation
effect:
Messages and directives are sent, faster than light,
on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of
relay stations.

"Your ship must immediately return to the nearest
Federation outpost, full speed." Place on one
Federation ship until outpost reached, then discard.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Incoming Message – Klingon
effect:
Messages and directives are sent, faster than light,
on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of
relay stations.

"Your ship must immediately return to the nearest
Klingon outpost, full speed." Place on one Klingon ship
until outpost reached, then discard.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Incoming Message – Romulan
effect:
Messages and directives are sent, faster than light,
on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of
relay stations.

"Your ship must immediately return to the nearest
Romulan outpost, full speed." Place on one Romulan
ship until outpost reached, then discard.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Interphase Generator
effect:
Experimental Romulan device that both cloaks and phases
matter, allowing it to pass through normal matter.

Use as Equipment card. Nullifies: Chalnoths, Archers,
Rebels, Impassable Doors, Phased Matter, Crystalline
Entities, Armus and Nausicaans.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Investigate "Shattered Space"
effect:
Lore - Neutral Zone Region • Near Neutral Zone: Study fragments of distorted space/time reported in this sector.
Reason - Early region mission.

name: Investigate Sighting
effect:
Lore - Beta Stromgen Stromgren: Investigate sighting of Gomtuu, an interstellar creature code-named, Tin Man.
Reason - Typo - wrong location name.

name: Investigate Time Continuum
effect:
Lore - Devidia Devidia II: Trace mysterious time-traveling aliens living in a parallel time continuum.
Reason - Typo - wrong location name.

name: Jaglom Shrek – Information Broker
effect:
Yridian dealer of information who uncovered the Romulan
prison camp in the Carraya system.

Look at opponent's draw deck for twenty seconds, then
replace unshuffled.

name: Kevin Uxbridge
effect:
Gametext - Nullifies any one Event card in play (except for Treaty cards) OR any one artifact in play other card played as an Event card. (Immune to Amanda Rogers.) {0}
Reason - Nerf. Added point box so you can't recycle used Kevin.

name: Khitomer Research
effect:
Attemptable - Added [Kli]
Reason - For some reason, didn't say Klingons could attempt.

name: Kivas Fajo - Collector
effect:
Treacherous collector of rare one-of-a-kind antiquities. Once
tried to add Lt. Commander Data to his collection.

Choose any player to immediately draw three new
cards from the top of their draw deck. Discard event
after use.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Klingon
effect: Title - Klingon Outpost - added ✤

Earth is a member of the United Federation of Planets. The
Federation establishes outposts throughout its territory.

Seed one if playing Klingon OR build later at any
location where you have a Klingon ENGINEER
is present.
Errata - Outpost cleanup.

name: Klingon Death Yell
effect:
Warning for the dead to beware; a Klingon warrior is
about to arrive. In Klingon myth, killed warriors with honor
go to Sto-Vo-Kor. Dishonered dead go to Gre'thor.

Plays on any just killed Klingon with Honor. Yell
to warn the dead and earn bonus points . May
play only one death yell for each such Klingon. Points = 5

name: Klingon Disruptor
effect:
Phase-disruptor used by Klingons and other races. Similar
to a phaser.

Klingon and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your
personnel STRENGTH +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

Rule - "Klingon" is written out. This means that Klingon
affiliation personnel and Klingon species personnel
(i.e. a Federation Worf) can use this equipment.

name: Klingon PADD
effect:
Standard Klingon Personnel Access Display Device for
computerized information.

Klingon use only. Each of your personnel CUNNING +2
where present. (Cumulative.)

Rule - "Klingon" is written out. This means that Klingon
affiliation personnel and Klingon species personnel
(i.e. a Federation Worf) can use this equipment.

name: Klingon Right of Vengeance
effect:
Under Klingon law, Lieutenant Worf claimed right of
vengeance against Duras in 2367.

If any Klingon is killed in an away team battle , all
other Klingons present may immediately re-attack
with double STRENGTH.

name: Ktarian Game
effect:
Psychotropically, mesmerizingly addictive game device.
One by one, its players are made susceptible to complete
mental control.

Place on ship. Now and start of each of your turns, one
person aboard (random selection) is disabled. Cured
when non-disabled CUNNING>30 OR android aboard.

Rule - Place on ship. Randomly select one crew member to
be disabled. If CUNNING>30 or an android remains in crew,
discard cured dilemma. Crew is not “stopped” and must
continue to next dilemma. Start of each of your turns,
randomly select another crew member to be disabled.
Discard dilemma when cured with non-disabled CUNNING >30
OR an android aboard.

name: Kurlan Naiskos
effect:
Statues which open to reveal a multitude of similar but
smaller figurines inside, representing the belief that each
person is a community of individual voices and desires.

Place in hand until played on any ship as an Event card.
If ship has all 7 personnel types aboard, its RANGE,
WEAPONS and SHIELDS are all tripled. (Not cumulative.)

RULE: The personnel type ANIMAL does not count for Kurlan
Naiskos.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Life-Form Scan
effect:
A special form of sensor scan capable of detecting
life-forms on planets or in space.

Glance at the cards in your opponent's hand for
ten seconds.

name: Long-Range Scan
effect:
Detects ships and phenomena at interstellar distances
using ship sensors.
Glance at the cards aboard any ship for ten seconds.

name: Lore Returns
effect:
Data's charismatic android brother. Identical except has
more emotional ability. Had a negative effect on Data.
Became Borg leader known as The One.

Plays where Rogue Borg have eliminated a ship's crew.
With Lore, your Rogue Borg may now use ship to
attack ships and/or beam to battle Away Teams.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Lore's Fingernail
effect:
Circuitry in Lore's finger was used to control and manipulate
Lt. Commander Data with emotions.

Plays on table. While in play, all Soong-type androids
(including Lt. Cmdr. Data) and Exocomps lose their
affiliation and are non-aligned personnel.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Loss of Orbital Stability
effect:
Gametext - Plays on any ship at a planet location orbiting a planet. Ship can't move for one turn. Also, ship is destroyed at end of next turn unless SHIELDS>4. Discard after use. has NO RANGE until end of turn, and is destroyed at end of its owner's next turn unless SHIELDS>4; then discard interrupt.
Reason - Changed to not be a response to movement.

name: Lwaxanna Troi
effect:
Title - Lwaxanna Lwaxana Troi
Reason - Typo in title.

name: Male's Love Interest
effect:
One of the many beautiful women who reside on the
paradise planet of Risa.

Male Away Team member (random selection) runs off
with lover to furthest planet, where he remains. Can
be rescued later. Discard dilemma.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.

name: Masaka Transformations
effect:
Masaka attempted to transform the U.S.S. Enterprise into
an ancient temple and grounds by rearranging its matter.

Plays on any player. That player must shuffle entire hand,
place on bottom of draw deck, then draw the same
number of cards from the top. Discard event after use.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Matriarchal Society
effect:
The planet Angel One was dominated by its women who
were intolerant of dealing with men.

Cannot get past unless at least two female Away Team
members are present.

Rule - If Away Team meets conditions (2 female), discard
dilemma and continue to next. If not, Away Team is
“stopped”; replace dilemma under mission to be
encountered again. (Gender-related; Borg player discards
immediately.)

name: Medical Kit
effect:
Representative of specialized medical equipment. Such
equipment has been developed by many races.

Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the
extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

name: Medical Tricorder
effect:
Representative of specialized tricorder optimized for
medical use. Such equipment has been developed by
many races.

Gives all of your SCIENCE-classification personnel the
extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

name: Mendon
effect:
Lore - Ensign Mendon is a Benzite male representative of science specialist specialists within Starfleet. Served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2365. Looks like Mordock.
Reason - Typo in lore.

name: Menthar Booby Trap
effect:
Relic from ancient Mentar-Promellian war. Aceton
assimilators trap passing ships, drain power, then emit
deadly radiation.

Place on ship; it cannot move. Unless MEDICAL present,
one crew member killed (random selection). Ship can't
move until 2 ENGINEER aboard. Discard with 2 ENGINEER
aboard.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.

name: Metaphasic Shields
effect:
Revolutionary shields using overlapping subspace fields.
Invented by Ferengi Dr. Reyga.

Plays on table. New technology enhances each of your
ship's SHIELDS +2 for each SCIENCE aboard. (Cumulative.)
Plays on your ship. SHIELDS +2 for each SCIENCE
classification personnel aboard.

Errata - Nerf. Now only affects one ship, and only for
classifications.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Microbiotic Colony
effect:
Rare subatomic spaceborne life-form that can cause severe
damage to a starship's hull.

Ship damaged unless SCIENCE, ENGINEER and OFFICER
aboard. Discard dilemma.

name: Microvirus
effect:
Genetic weapon designed to attack humanoids who have
specific DNA sequences.

Kills one Away Team member (opponent's
choice), unless MEDICAL and SECURITY
present. Discard dilemma. Points = 5

Rule - If Away Team meets conditions (MEDICAL and SECURITY),
place dilemma in bonus point area and continue to
next. If not, opponent chooses one Away Team member to
be killed; Away Team is “stopped”; discard dilemma.

name: Nagilum
effect:
Extra-dimensional entity willing to kill in order to
understand the concept of mortality.

Half of crew is killed (random selection, round
down) unless 3 Diplomacy OR STRENGTH>40
aboard. Discard dilemma. Points = 5

Rule - If crew meets conditions (3 Diplomacy OR
STRENGTH>40), place dilemma in bonus point area
and continue to next. If not, randomly select
half of crew (round down; half of one rounded
down is zero) to be killed; ship and crew are
“stopped”; discard dilemma.

name: Nanites
effect:
Originally, submicroscopic robots used for medical therapy.
Now, self-replicating sentient life-forms who can disable
computer systems.

Damages afflicted ship unless 2 SCIENCE
OR Diplomacy present. Discard Dilemma. Points = 5

Rule - If crew meets conditions (2 SCIENCE OR
Diplomacy), place dilemma in bonus point
area and continue to next. If not, ship
is damaged; ship and crew are “stopped”;
discard dilemma.

name: Nausicaans
effect:
Tall humanoid species with a quick temper. A Nausicaan
once stabbed Jean-Luc Picard through the heart with a knife.

Three Nausicaans pick a fight. One Away Team member
is killed (random selection) unless STRENGTH>44.
Discard dilemma.

Rule - If Away eam meets conditions (STRENGTH>44),
discard dilemma and continue to next. If not,
randomly select one Away Team member to be killed;
Away Team is “stopped”; discard dilemma.

name: Near-Warp Transport
effect: Physically disconcerting transport at high-speed.

Allows beaming from ship to a neighboring spaceline
location . Transport a maximum of six of your
personnel and/or your equipment.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Neural Servo Device
effect:
Device which can be used to control a crew by activating
pain causing implants.

Plays on any non-aligned ship. Unless 2 SECURITY
aboard, use ship and crew for one turn as your own.
Discard event.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Nitrium Metal Parasites
effect:
Microscopic life-forms that normally live in asteroids but
can infest and damage ships by ingesting nitrium.

Place on ship. Ship can still move, but is destroyed
at the end of your second full turn unless 2 SCIENCE
OR 2 ENGINEER aboard by that time.

Rule - Place on ship. If 2 SCIENCE OR 2 ENGINEER in crew,
discard cured dilemma and continue to next.
Otherwise, crew is not “stopped” and must continue
to next dilemma. If 2 SCIENCE OR 2 ENGINEER aboard
before end of your second full turn, discard cured
dilemma; otherwise, ship is destroyed (discard
with all cards aboard).

name: Null Space
effect:
A rare, invisible pocket of space caused by turbulence
during star formation. Absorbs all energy.

Ship hits null space turbulence and is
damaged unless 2 Navigation aboard.
Discard dilemma. Points = 5

Rule - If crew meets conditions (2 Navigation), place
dilemma in bonus point area and continue to next.
If not, ship is damaged; ship and crew are
“stopped”; discard dilemma.

name: Nutational Shields
effect:
Nutation adjusts the shield frequency phase rotation,
thereby increasing shield efficiency. Used against the Borg
in 2367.

Plays on table. New technology enhances each of your
ship's SHIELDS +2 for each ENGINEER aboard.
(Cumulative.) Plays on your ship. SHIELDS +2 for each
ENGINEER classification personnel aboard.

Errata - Nerf. Now only affects one ship, and only for
classifications.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Palor Toff – Alien Trader
effect:
Rich merchant and trader from an unknown race. Friend of
Kivas Fajo. Snappy dresser.

Exchange this card for any non-Personnel card in your
discard pile .
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Particle Fountain
effect:
Experimental orbital station built by Dr. Farallon for mining
a planet from space. Rumored to be effective for
atmospheric depletion.

If 2 ENGINEER present in Away Team, play
particle fountain (maximum of one) on just
completed planet mission for bonus points. Points = 5
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Pattern Enhancers
effect:
Devices which amplify transporter signals to enhance
transporter beam power in hazardous areas.

Plays on table. Allows your personnel and equipment
unlimited beaming through atmospheric ionization or
distortion fields.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Phased Matter
effect:
Phased personnel vibrate out of sync with normal matter,
rendering them undetectable. Phased people cannot
interact with non-phased people.

Away Team is split into two Away Teams (your
choice). Only the smaller team may beam up until
ENGINEER and SCIENCE present. Larger team is
phased and cannot beam until cured by ENGINEER and
SCIENCE in another Away Team on planet.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.

name: Plasma Fire
effect:
Intensely hot combustion of ionized plasma gas.
Dangerous fire which can destroy a ship.

Plays on any ship, except Borg ship. Fire damages ship
at end of next turn and continues damaging each turn.
SECURITY puts it out. Discard after use.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Portal Guard
effect:
Portal 63 is the last remaining protector of the Tkon
Empire, which went extinct 600,000 years ago.
Challenges those who awaken him.

Unless at least one Away Team member has
CUNNING>7 OR Honor, the entire Away Team must
abort mission and beam up or die.

Rule - If Away Team meets conditions (at least one
Away Team member with CUNNING>7 OR Honor), discard
dilemma and continue to next. If not, entire Away
Team must attempt to beam up to ship or facility.
If entire Away Team beams up they are “stopped”.
If any are prevented from beaming up, or if no
place to beam to, entire Away Team is killed.
Replace dilemma under mission to be encountered
again, whether Away Team escaped or not. (“Abort
mission” has no effect on resolution for Borg;
must still beam up or die. Unity Drone has no
effect on individual CUNNING.)

name: Q
effect:
Incorrigible, extra-dimensional member of the Q
Continuum, a race of omnipotent beings. Q exhibits a
child-like petulance and sense of playfulness.

If Unless 2 Leadership and INTEGRITY>60, discard
all dilemmas here. Otherwise, Q allows opponent
to rearrange spaceline locations. stops crew or Away
Team. Discard dilemma.

Errata - Massive nerf which was needed - the Q dilemma was
way way way too powerful.

name: Q-Net
effect:
Q used an enormous forcefield grid in space to stop the
U.S.S. Enterprise in 2364.

Plays between two adjacent spaceline locations. No
ship may pass the Q-Net unless 2 Diplomacy aboard.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Q2
effect:
Member of the Q who observed Q's act of self-sacrifice
and re-instated him in the Q continuum.

Nullifies any Amanda Rogers OR Kevin Uxbridge just
played, OR nullifies any Q-related dilemma . Countdown = 0
Errata - Nerf. Point box prevents recycling.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Radioactive Garbage Scow
effect:
Barges containing dangerous waste can be adrift for
centuries. One such barge threatened Gamelon V in 2367.

Place on spaceline here. Mission cannot be done
attempted where present. Ship with Tractor Beam
and 2 ENGINEER can tow barge to a different
location scow.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.

name: Raise The Stakes
effect:
Weekly poker game aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise honed
the tactical and bluffing skills of many officers.

Your opponent must forfeit the game OR agree the
eventual winner may randomly select and keep one
card from loser's 60-card deck. (Cumulative.)
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Rebel Encounter
effect:
Belligerent rebels from war-torn worlds often hide out on
other planets and can endanger an Away Team.

Kills one Away Team member (random selection) unless
STRENGTH>44 OR you bribe rebels first by discarding
an Equipment card, if present. Discard dilemma.

Rule - If Away Team meets conditions (STRENGTH>44 OR
you discard an Equipment card from Away Team),
discard dilemma and continue to next. If not,
randomly select one Away Team member to be killed;
Away Team is “stopped”; discard dilemma.

name: Red Alert!
effect: The state of maximum crew and systems readiness aboard starships.

Plays on table. Allows you to play as many In place of
your normal card play, you may report for duty any
number of Ship, Personnel, and Equipment cards as
desired each turn.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: REM Fatigue Hallucinations
effect:
A crew can go insane from lack of REM (rapid eye
movement) sleep.

No one aboard can dream. Entire crew or Away Team
dies in three of your full turns unless 3 MEDICAL
present OR ship returns to outpost first. Points=5

Errata -Dual mission card. No functional change, removed
unneeded 'fluff' from gametext.

name: Res-Q
effect:
Q once saved Captain Jean-Luc Picard's life following an
injury from a compressed teryon beam.

Regenerates a card. Exchange this event for any one
card from your discard pile.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Rogue Borg Mercenaries
effect:
Upon Hugh's return to the Borg collective, the Borg
became self-aware. Soon, many unquestioningly followed
their first leader, Lore.

Plays on any occupied ship. Battles crew now and at
start of every players' turn. Two Borg =2 STRENGTH
each, three =3 each, etc. Surviving Borg remain.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Romulan
effect: Title - Romulan Outpost - added ✤

Romulus is one of the two homeworlds for the Romulans.
The Romulan Star Empire establishes outposts throughout
its territory

Seed one if playing Romulan OR build later at any
location where you have a Romulan ENGINEER
is present.
Errata - Outpost cleanup.

name: Romulan Disruptor
effect:
Directed-energy weapon used by Romulans and other
races. Disruptor fire can be identified by a high residue of
antriprotons that linger for several hours.

Romulan and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your
personnel STRENGTH +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

Rule - "Romulan" is written out. This means that Romulan
affiliation personnel and Romulan species personnel
can use this equipment.

name: Romulan PADD
effect:
Standard Romulan Personnel Access Display Device for
computerized information.

Romulan use only. Each of your personnel CUNNING +2
where present. (Cumulative.)

Rule - "Romulan" is written out. This means that Romulan
affiliation personnel and Romulan species personnel
can use this equipment.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Sarjenka
effect:
Alien child from Drema IV. Her radio pleas for help were
answered by Lt. Commander Data in violation of the
Prime Directive.

Primitive alien begs for help. Ignore her
(discard dilemma) OR help her and earn bonus
points, but all Away Teams here are "stopped." Points=5

Rule - Make choice: • Ignore Sarjenka; discard dilemma
and continue to next. (Borg player must choose this
non-points option.) • Help Sarjenka; all Away Teams on
planet are “stopped”. Place dilemma in bonus point area.

name: Scan
effect:
Gametext - Glance at the Dilemma and Artifact all seed cards located under one space mission for twenty seconds.
Reason - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.

name: Shaka, When The Walls Fell
effect:
"Shaka, when the walls fell," means inability to
understand. The incomprehensible Tamarians spoke
entirely in metaphors.

Must have 2 Diplomacy and CUNNING>30 to
communicate and proceed.

Rule - If Away Team/crew meets conditions (2 Diplomacy
and CUNNING>30), discard dilemma and continue to next.
If not, Away Team/ship and crew are “stopped”; replace
dilemma under mission to be encountered again.

name: Ship Seizure
effect:
Tractor beams are focused linear graviton beams which
can be used to seize or tow objects in space.

If your ship has tractor beams, tow away (discard) any
empty ships in the same orbit as your own ship (except
empty ships at their outpost).

name: Spacedock
effect:
Orbital repair and building facility for starships. Such
facilities have been developed by many races.

Plays on outpost. Instantly repairs your damaged ships
if they stop here. Also repairs non-aligned ships.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Starfleet Type II Phaser
effect:
Handheld weapon can be set for stun, heat and disruption.
PHASER is an acronym for PHASed Energy Rectification.

Federation and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your
personnel STRENGTH +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

name: Static Warp Bubble
effect:
Dr. Beverly Crusher experienced a shrinking universe,
shaped by her own thoughts, inside a static warp bubble
created by Ensign Wesley Crusher.

Plays on table. Opponent must discard one card before
ending each turn. (Not cumulative.)
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Subspace Interference
effect:
Disruptions of subspace communications can be caused by
nebulae and other phenomena.

Prevents (nullifies) reception of Incoming Message
OR Hail OR Subspace Schism. Both cards are discarded .

name: Subspace Schism
effect:
Solonagen-based aliens from another subspace domain
accessed our space to abduct people for experiments.

Plays within five seconds of either players' card draw.
That player must discard that card and re-draw.

name: Subspace Warp Rift
effect:
Dr. Serova proved in 2370 that disastrous rifts occur in the
fabric of space due to the excessive use of warp drive.
Discovery led to a Federation-wide speed limit of warp 5.

Plays crosswise on any spaceline location. Any ship
passing over here without stopping incurs damage.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Supernova
effect:
The explosion of a star, usually caused by natural
processes toward the end of its life cycle.

You must have Tox Uthat on table. Place atop any
mission. Everything there is destroyed (discarded), but
leave Mission card underneath for span reference.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: T'Pan
effect:
Gametext - [SD] SCIENCE [SD] Mindmeld
Reason - Typo - She should've had Mindmeld to begin with.

name: Tachyon Detection Grid
effect:
Network of active tachyon beams between many ships.
Devised by Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge in 2368 to
detect cloaked vessels.

Must have at least four of your ships in play to use.
Play on any cloaked ship to detect its presence. Ship is
forced to de-cloak for rest of turn.

name: Tarellian Plague Ship
effect:
Ship containing the survivors of a Tarellia war plague.
Infected from biological weapons, they are now refused
entry everywhere.

All ship's Entire crew immediately dies from plague
unless MEDICAL volunteers to permanently beam
over "beams over" (discarded) to Tarellians.
Discard dilemma. Points = 5
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.

name: Telepathic Alien Kidnappers
effect:
Unknown aliens abducted Captain Jean-Luc Picard for
telepathic studies about authority in 2366.

Plays on table. At end of each turn, guess a card type
and point to a card in your opponent's hand. Card
must be shown. If guessed correctly, card is discarded.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Temporal Causality Loop
effect:
Localized distortion causes time to repeat ad infinitum.
U.S.S. Bozeman was trapped for 90 years in a temporal
oop that held the U.S.S. Enterprise for 17.4 days.

Unless SCIENCE and CUNNING>35, undo your
last two actions of this turn and end turn.
Discard dilemma. Points = 5

Rule - If crew meets conditions (SCIENCE and
CUNNING>35), place dilemma in bonus point area and
continue to next. If not, undo your last two actions
of this turn; ship and crew are “stopped”; discard
dilemma; end turn immediately.

name: Temporal Rift
effect: Icon Bar - Countdown = 2

Time displacement caused by ultra high energy explosions
such as that which affected the U.S.S. Enterprise-C at
Narendra III.

Plays on your ship. Ship disappears and
must reappear here after two of your
full turns. Discard interrupt after
reappearance. When countdown expires,
ship reappears here.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.

name: Tetryon Field
effect:
Intense masses of subspace particles, unstable in normal
space, which require ships to route through safe corridors.

Plays crosswise on any spaceline location. All ships
must stop here before proceeding on next turn, unless
Navigation aboard.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: The Devil
effect:
Ardra recreated the human mythical figure the Devil on
Ventax II.

Destroys any one Treaty card on table OR one
Horga'hn on table OR one Wind Dancer.

name: The Juggler
effect:
Icon Bar - Added [Referee]
Reason - Added Ref from Q the Ref.
Lore - The Juggler hosted Lwaxanna Lwaxana Troi and Alexamder Rozhenko's visit to the Parallax Colony, all the time juggling his three words.

name: The Traveler: Transcendence
effect:
Benevolent humanoid from Tau Alpha C who could
transcend space and time with thought.

Place beside any player's draw deck. That player must
draw one extra card at the end of each turn. Also, while
in play, nullifies Static Warp Bubble (Not cumulative.)
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Thought Maker
effect:
Outlawed Ferengi mind control device. Transmits signals
that implant sensory experiences and triggers emotions
and memories.

Place in hand until played once as an Interrupt card.
Look at opponent's draw deck for ten seconds and
rearrange as desired.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Time Travel Pod
effect:
Craft from the future, stolen in the past by Berlinghoff
Rasmussen for his own gain.

Place in hand until played once as an Interrupt card o
any ship. That ship travels into the future (disappears
for up to 5 turns). Pre-announce the return time.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Toral
effect:
Lore - Illegitimate son of Duras. Claimed leadership position on the High Council at bidding of half Duras' sisters, Lursa and B'Etor.
Reason - Typo in lore.

name: Tox Uthat
effect:
Dangerous quantum phase inhibitor invented in the future
by Kal Dano who hid it in the 22nd century for safekeeping.

Place in hand until played on table as an event
(supernova can be played on later turn) OR as an
interrupt (prevents supernova). Discard after use.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Transwarp Conduit
effect:
New Borg technology which creates an artificial subspace
tunnel that increases effective warp speed.
Select a ship. It can move double range for this turn.

name: Treaty: Federation/Klingon
effect:
Past treaties between these powers included the
Treaty of Alliance creating mutual aide and defense
without intervention.

Plays on table. Your Federation and Klingon affiliations
recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Treaty: Federation/Romulan
effect:
Past treaties between these powers included the Treaty of
Algeron, which created a neutral zone and outlawed Federation cloaking devices.

Plays on table. Your Federation and Romulan affiliations
recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

name: Tricorder
effect:
Representative of multipurpose handheld device
combining sensors, computers and recorders. Such
equipment has been developed by many races.

Gives all of your ENGINEER-classification personnel the
extra skill of SCIENCE where present.

name: Tsiolkovsky Infection
effect:
Variety of water-based Psi 2000 virus. Passed by
perspiration. Creates dangerous intoxication-like instability
among a crew.

Place aboard ship. It is now infected. Mission can
continue continues, but all personnel, while aboard,
lose their first-listed skill. Cure with 3 MEDICAL to discard.
(Not cumulative.)
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext

name: Two-Dimensional Creatures
effect:
Perfectly flat spaceborne creatures from a two-dimensional
spatial continuum. Ensnared the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367
and impeded Counselor Deanna Troi's empathic abilities.

Place on ship. Empaths aboard are disabled.
Also, Ship can't move until SCIENCE and
ENGINEER present aboard, discarding dilemma
and curing empaths.
Errata - No functional change, cleaned up gametext

name: U.S.S. Oberth (typo)
effect:
Reportly some versions in Premiere were printed with the following lore - Class of small ships often used for scientific missions. Named for 20th century rocket scientist Hermann Herman Oberth.

No evidence of such a card ever existed. There is no image.
Reason - Typo in lore.

name: Varon-T Disruptor
effect:
Only five of these pistols were made before being
banned by the Federation. These vicious weapons
disupt the body from the inside out, causing a slow
and painful death.

Use as Equipment card. Doubles all of your personnel's
STRENGTH where present. (Not cumulative.)
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Vulcan Mindmeld
effect:
Gametext - Allows all Mindmeld personnel, at one location, to add to their skills. For one turn, add all of the skills of another personnel who is present. Plays at any location. Each of your Mindmeld personnel there may select another of your personnel present and add that personnel's skills to their own until end of turn.
Reason - No functional change, cleaned up gametext.

name: Vulcan Stone of Gol
effect:
Ancient Vulcan telepathic weapon. Kills by magnifying
aggressive and violent thoughts, but can be blocked by
peaceful thoughts.

Plays in hand until played as an Event card.
Kills everyone in an Away Team without Youth
OR CUNNING>7. Discard artifact.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Warp Core Breach
effect:
In warp propulsion systems, if the magnetic confinement
field collapses, matter and antimatter collide causing the
ship to explode.

Plays on any ship, except Borg ship. Ship explodes at
end of owner's next turn, unless ENGINEER aboard by
then. Discard after use.

name: Wesley Crusher
effect:
Lore - Ensign Wesley Crusher was a child prodigy. Protege' Protégé of the Traveler. Son of Dr. Beverly Crusher. Saved the U.S.S. Enterprise 3 1/2 times as a teenager.
Reason - Typo in lore.

name: Where No One Has Gone Before
effect:
The Traveler transcends space with thought. Took the
U.S.S. Enterprise to Galaxy M-33, then to an even greater
extragalactic distance.

Plays on table. Allows all your ships to leave one end
of the spaceline and enter the other end.

name: Wind Dancer
effect:
Sentry of the Parallax Colony. Only allows those whose
hearts are joyous to pass.

To get past, Lwaxanna Lwaxana Troi must be present
OR at least one Away Team member must have: Youth
OR Music OR STRENGTH>9.
Errata - Typo on Lwaxana's name.

name: Wormhole
effect:
Gametext - Requires two wormholes. Play one on any ship just as it begins to move. Play the other where the ship immediately emerges. Discard wormholes. on your ship. Play the other at any location. Ship relocates to that location (and then is "stopped").
Reason - Nerf. Can't worm enemy ships.
